stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:

  • The amount of precipitate will decrease, not increase. The response provides a correct explanation.

  • The amount of precipitate will decrease, not increase. When the pH MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGWbGaaeisaaaa@3AB9@ is lowered, the excess H + MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pe9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeisamaaCaaaleqabaGaey4kaScaaaaa@3771@ will react with OH − MathType@MTEF@5@5@@384E@ , reducing [ OH − ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A18@ and therefore allowing additional Cu 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C84@ and OH − MathType@MTEF@5@5@@384E@ ions to enter solution, which increases the solubility of Cu(OH) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E96@ .
